tab.name: intro
tab.label: Summary
tab.content: Brighton is a lively and eclectic city on the south coast, the first place in Britain to elect a Green MP to parliament. Here in the eccentric lanes you can find antiques and sticks of rock rubbing up against alternative lifestyles and bohemian boutiques. There are dozens of intriguing little corners to explore, and endless distractions for the curious. The ideal location for a Treasure Hunt!

tab.name: details
tab.label: Hunt Info
tab.content:
Hunts The pack includes a treasure trail and a bonus round.

Duration 2 hours or so, not including breaks.

Suitability Suitable for any size of group from 1 to 8, good for families. The streets of Brighton are accessible to all, though there are some hilly roads.

Requirements Just a pencil and paper, and a sensible pair of shoes.

tab.name: todo
tab.label: Things to do
tab.content:
• Visit the Brighton Pavilion, a Prince's playhouse
  • Come in May to enjoy England's largest performing arts festival, The Brighton Festival
  • Amble around the North Laines, the biggest gathering of eclectic one-off shopping outside London
  • In May or December, shop for arts and crafts at the Artists' Open Houses
